page.title: 11The Swansea Blitz
page.content: by Kimberely Jones The person I questioned about the Blitz was my granny Lilly Jones. 'The war broke out in 1939. I was 14 years old and had just left school. The windows had to be blacked out and the streets were very dark. Every street had an ARP warden. Every street had to have a water pump, ladder and bags of sand. I remember helping my father to put out an incendery bomb. These were sent before the big bombs so that the pilots knew their targets. A bomb was about 10 yards from where I lived, in Dyfatty school. I was in the Elysium cinema when all of a sudden the sirens went and a bomb was dropped near to the cinema. We all had to get outside and lie in the gutter until it had passed.'
